website_summaries.verdict: The best planer on the market in terms of performance, longevity, and reliability over time.
pros: Easily handles larger cuts with a powerful motor and multi-knife cutter-head
cons: Blades can dull fairly quickly, especially on bigger cuts

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous malfunction!
customer_reviews.text: While running a piece of 2x8x8 pine through the planer I heard a loud bang then the planer shut down. After closer inspection, I could see what looked like a major malfunction with the blade and cast broken into pieces. Luckily I wasn't injured from pieces of the blade sent flying out the machine. I'm not sure what happened but I would consider alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: What a useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: I am just a hobbyist making custom furniture. Since the hobby is not my full time job this machine works fine for my needs. The only draw back is the amount of wood chips produced. A 33 gallon trash can a piece of plywood a screen and old shirt make that a no issue. As far as how the wood turns out... excellent. I use mine in the low speed mode and only take a small bit at a time, using Maple and oak I am still on the first set of blades. So feel confident that this is a good purchase, if your needs are similar to mine.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Mulvin

customer_reviews.title: Cannot raise or lower cutter head
customer_reviews.text: On arrival, the cutter height was set to around an inch and the depth stop was set up to stop the cut at a minimum depth of just an 1/8". The chain mechanism was somehow jammed such that cranking real hard on the wheel only moved the depth a small amount - wish I knew it was a common problem before purchasing. Waiting for UPS to show up was pretty bad. Not the day promised and 7:40pm when UPS gave a window between 11 and 3. The replacement from Amazon works fine and arrived in 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Received a used and broken planer
customer_reviews.text: I was SO excited for a new planer, but it arrived with a broken base (pictured) and a scratched infeed ramp. Nowhere on the listing did it say this product was used or refurbished, yet I received not only a broken product but one that had clearly been used before.
customer_reviews.author: Nick K.

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars across the Board
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome tool, makes wood working a breeze. I have already saved my money from the purchase! I use to buy 1x2, 2x2, 1x3 and assorted other size pieces of wood. And face it, Wood today is poorly milled and just about unreachable unless it’s a big box store. There you have to sort, move heavy loads around, it’s a nightmare. So with the Dewalt Planer I have limited some of this sorting and purchasing multiple size pieces of wood. I now buy the bigger boards, rip them into multiple thicknesses on the table saw and then run through this planer for the perfect thickness for my projects and a finish that is almost perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Toni B.

customer_reviews.title: DeWALT's Support is Absolutely Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The BIG BOLD WARRENTIES that cover an entire screen look nice but DeWALT's support is absolutely terrible. Thankfully Amazon resolved my problem with the rollers no longer working by refunding me the money for the planer.
customer_reviews.author: Luke K.

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: A well made and beast of a machine. Two things I don't like. The end stop knob will only work for 4 or five settings. Like 1/2, 1/4 ,1/8 . I need it for 5/16 and 3/16 . Poor planning. I had a Delta your many years and used for boards as short as 7 inches. When it finally gave out I upgraded to the De Walt. You can't run short boards through this machine. I never thought, but the rollers are much further apart than the smaller Delta. The short boards fall as they come out and tear apart. Chews them up. Haven't had it long but does a good job otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: B Starcher

customer_reviews.title: It's a great planer. I'll skip what's already been said
customer_reviews.text: I've used the planer for about 8 months. It gets weekly usage. Almost all pine. It's a great planer. I'll skip what's already been said. If you're using a 4" hose to collect the chips into a bag or can, be conscious of the noise the planer makes and how many chips are dropping down from the blade area. This is an indicator of the receptacle filing up. The blades on it usually leave a small ridge on the wood that easily sands away. Not much snipe with the tables on each side. It's very loud so protect your hearing, I said PROTECT YOUR HEARING!!
customer_reviews.author: Wayneled

customer_reviews.title: A must for the woodworking hobby...
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed every planer I could think of and landed on this one...I’m glad I did. The price is right and the performance matches. So far I’ve run a few hundred board feet though and don’t have any issues. The blades are still going strong, and it came with an extra set for when I need them. I use it with a dust extractor, which you really need. Had the hose fall off once during use, and it shot wood chips/dust across my garage! If you are a casual woodworker, this is an investment you shouldn’t pass up.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Not heavily used but I love it
customer_reviews.text: This thing works awesome. It's my first planer so I don't have much to compare it to but it cuts smooth and is easy to learn. Tip: I did run into an issue after a short bit of using it where the material would get stuck going through so I'd have to help it along. I learned that it was likely due to the feed tables not being waxed. So I got some wax and it worked perfectly again.
customer_reviews.author: TateD

customer_reviews.title: On a different level than my old delta
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! My old Delta started rattling like it would explode so it seemed time to replace. Based on reviews, I chose the DW735x. It arrived quickly. It’s much heavier so rather than wrestle with it I built a rolling cart for it, screwed it down and now it is a breeze to roll it out for large or small jobs. It is much quieter, so much so that I thought it wasn’t taking anything off the first pass on a pice of rough sawn black walnut. Moved to the outfeed and what was coming out looked finish ready. So much smoother than I ever had with the old delta. It’s expensive, but will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: linna

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked wonderful out of the box. My first task was to surface some 3.5" thick beams down to 3 inches. It did a wonderful job! My only suggestion is stop and clean the table surface along the way. I had a few pitchy pieces that led to issues with the feeding of subsequent beams. A little cleaning, and back to a smooth operation. Well done DeWalt!
customer_reviews.author: FreeJam71

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Planer
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received had to be sent back as it was very hard to raise or lower the cutters, really hard and I knew there was a problem. The replacement has worked without a hitch. Smooth operation and cut after each pass. Highly recommend the planer. What I don't recommend is Dewalt's nonexistent customer service. You get a answering machine telling you to submit an email and you'll get a reply within like 24 business hours. They never ever replied! Luckily I bought through Amazon Prime so just took it to the UPS store and off it went. I love Amazon Prime!
customer_reviews.author: Bill F

customer_reviews.title: Have a plan for Chip or Dust collection before buying
customer_reviews.text: Good strong machine. Heavy for one person to move around. Dust (chip) collection options stink. I ran the machine the first time and it blew chips 15' out. Decided I would buy the Dewalt Chip collector 4" tube and bag that fits over a trash can (part#7353, I think)...Seems that item is NOT being made any more. I would hope one day that they begin to make it and it shows up on the list below the item in the 'accessories' section: "Customers who bought the above item frequently bought this"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic planer! Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: The funny thing is that I sold a beefy Woodmaster planer last year thinking I wouldn't be doing any more projects with lumber that required planing. Wrong!! So I bought this one and let me tell you, I Love this machine, especially for the money! Good features, fairly compact and works very well. I had read reviews saying the blades didn't stay sharp.... well I don't get it because I just finished a project that I planed tons of cherry and ash for and the surfaces are still crisp and clean. The depth scale and height adjustability allow planing to precise thickness without using a tape measure
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rags

customer_reviews.title: As rated in all wordworking magazines who tested it, this is the best of the pack....
customer_reviews.text: This two stage planer performs exactly as described in almost all of the woodworking magazines that tested it and rated it the best of all planers in this category. No, it is not designed to replace commercial planers found in sawmills; it IS however, an excellent planer for the hobbyist and not-so-hobbyist woodworker who has a need to plane a few boards for his next furniture project. The blades are easily removed for replacement/sharpening as needed and it thins boards to as close to your exact thickness as any machine out there. Yes, it costs a few bucks more but your frustration level will disappear when you use this machine. Isn't THAT worth something?
customer_reviews.author: Gunther

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite shop machine.
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with the accuracy, ease of use & most of all the final finish cut. And by adding my own bagger system with the planer’s built in chip blower there’s very little mess. A powerhouse in a small package!
customer_reviews.author: Steel414

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool - just make sure it is cleaned and prepped for each use
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool, but did have a problem with the feeder during cold days. The rubber belt becomes too hard and stop feeding. This is ok, I just don’t use it on cold days. Another suggestion is to clean it before each use (belt-roller) with mineral spirits, and put past wax on the stainless feeder plate. Makes the roller grip and the surface slick, so the wood feeds much easier. I have had it over a year, and really like it. They need to add some specific cleaning instructions/suggestions in bold print. I almost sent it back after the first month, until I found some cleaning suggestions on an internet post.
customer_reviews.author: TurkeyBuzzard_

customer_reviews.title: Another awesome DeWalt product. Worth every dollar
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived on time and in 100% off the shelf great condition. Jointed a 6”x28”x 3/4” piece of maple and planed down to 1/2”. Checking the board with machinist caliper, within .0025” all around 4 corners and center. One more pass on jointer and I’m sure it would be closer. Great thickness planer with easy setup. Weighs close to 100 pounds, solid and stout on a rolling tool bench top. Didn’t walk around, but still recommend bolting down. Read the directions twice! Certain switches should not be changed in the power off state.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepgarden

customer_reviews.title: Defective item
customer_reviews.text: Arrived non functional, the body would not raise up or down without seriously cranking on the wheel. Am having replaced but I'd always heard good things about this planer being bombproof, maybe not so much or maybe this just got past qa, will update this if the replacement is fine but pretty disappointed right now
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Hamblin

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you watch videos before buying. It is a great buy and education is very helpful
customer_reviews.text: It's very loud make sure you have ear protection. It's very easy to use. For best performance make sure you look up videos. Even though it appears plug and plane there are things you should adjust for best performance such as leveling your in and out feed trays. Dust collection is easy and several methods to that madness. I used a metal dryer hose to a sealed trashcan that I modified. The chip ejection is powerful so I again suggest looking up videos unless you plan to just let them go in your yard.
customer_reviews.author: Comedy Hypnotist Michael Oddo

customer_reviews.title: Really blows the shavings.
customer_reviews.text: Great planer. This thing really blows out the shavings. That's my problem now is getting the right container to receive the wood shavings. It will over power a shop vac and blow the lid off. I made a makeshift box to collect. But can't afford just yet a dust collector. Also, don't run knotty boards through this. The small debris will get stuck under the blades then cause havoc. Which then transfers to the wood ran through causing ridges and valleys in the wood. Does the job to plane but then I just sand my finished pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great cuts
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. It had no problems making toothpicks out of any boards I ran through it. Cuts were smooth with no chip out. The box it came in protected it during shipping, but was awkward and heavy to lift. Once it was put to use it was apparent I had made the right choice. With 2 speeds to chose from this is a great little planer and it will cause me to kill lots of trees. I would recommend it be placed on some type of cart or permanently mounted as it is heavy(for a portable).
customer_reviews.author: AKFred

customer_reviews.title: Great planer
customer_reviews.text: This planer is awesome. One of the best on the market. Priced for the average woodworker a little high but definitely worth it. It is very consistent and reliable. This definitely stands up to the Dewalt name. Very Easy to use. Intuitive controls. Comes with an extra set of blades as well as in feed and out feed tables. Dust collection has built in blower. Shop vac cannot keep up with it. Best to use with only a cyclone dust collector without the vacuum attached.
customer_reviews.author: BrianAndCyn

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how anybody buys any other brand. This isn’t that much more expensive than the competition but it’s packed with extra features. The finish it left even at low speed was so fine the wood doesn’t even need any post finishing. In fact it almost seems too smooth, like you’d need to scuff sand it before a glue up. I almost sprung for a shelix at the same time but that hardly seems necessary now. Maybe after both sets of blades wear out (they are also very easy to rotate/change).
customer_reviews.author: GetOffMyInternet!

customer_reviews.title: The blades are horrible!!!! upgrade the blades is a MUST!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the first machine I received because it would not raise or lower. It bond up after about 1/4". Amazon sent my replacement ASAP and it works AMAZINGLY, the only problem is. after running my first/ Maple/Walnut/Purple Heart cutting board through it, the blades went dull and chipped. The Cutting board is only 12"x18"x3/4". It sucks that I need to spend another $200 on a good set of carbide blades. might as well just by the Shelix Cutter head.
customer_reviews.author: Ruelas

customer_reviews.title: beautiful finish
customer_reviews.text: Professional quality finish at a great price. I spent a little more than the cheapo machines but the finish produced by this planer is unbelievable. Highly recommend. Virtually no snipe, the fan powered exhaust port is powerful. It will fill your shop with wood shavings if you don't use your dust collection.
customer_reviews.author: margo c

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT SHINES AGAIN!!!
customer_reviews.text: As a woodworker over the decades I have owned a variety of different make tools and Delta and DeWalt are by far some of my favorite. This is my second DeWalt planner and as with the first I am very happy with it. I would still have the first but it was relocated to someone else during a robbery. My insurance company replaced it with a Steel City unite that lasted for about 15 years before it gave up the ghost. Because of the good service I have experienced from other DeWalt tools I have owned I chose this unit and so far I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Planer
customer_reviews.text: Prior to purchasing this Dewalt planer, I had only used the big Grizzly in my Dads shop. I've wasting time for years trying to do without a planer, but my most recent project demanded it...and man am I glad it did. This is a fantastic tool. It is easy to use and performs with high precision. I could not have completed this project as quickly, or with the quality of results without it. It is my new favorite toy...and the router table is right behind it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Missing screw makes the tool unusable
customer_reviews.text: The planer shipped and arrived on time. During set-up i noticed that the packaging is missing the screw to attach the depth adjustment crank handle. Instruction manual said it's inside the handle's shaft but i didn't see it. Nor was it anywhere in the box or the styrofoam packaging. Cannot raise or lower without the screw, and so far Dewalt has not responded. Very frustrating experience.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: What a beast, and the 735X has nice add-ons
customer_reviews.text: The 735X is a great value. It comes with the tables and an extra set of blades -- easily makes up the $50 difference between the 735 and this. I've planed a few things on it since received a week ago and it works like a dream. It's not too noisy, and the chip ejection fan is great. Don't even have to run the vac! Amazon delivered it via lift gate truck and put it right where I asked them to. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J M

customer_reviews.title: A hobbyist best choice
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down and decided it was time to purchase a planer, I looked at every single planer here on amazon, read nearly every review here and across the net, Ultimately I settled on this on. As soon as it arrived I took it out and other than attaching the crank handle and the two plates she was ready to go. One of the things i noticed was a lot people claimed that it is loud. I honestly didn't find it any louder than a push mower. The chip ejection is awesome, make sure you buy a dust collector for this bad boy or you will be doing a lot sweeping twenty feet away.
customer_reviews.author: Ken the Mad

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy DIY’er bench planner.
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s working great. Have only used it on a dresser drawers project for now. But will be building the rest of my new bedroom set over the coming months. UPDATE: the price on this has drop from $649 to $529 (what I paid) to $499 in JUST ONE MONTH!!! If you were thinking about buying it before.......you might want to grab one now! UPDATE #2 ANOTHER PRICE DROP $479!! DeWalt must be coming out with a new model to its 18 year old design........maybe a FlexVolt version??!!! I bought a Shelix blade head for it, based on reviews of it and the Dewalt factory blades. I probably won’t install it until the factory blades need replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: WOW, wish I had one of these years ago
customer_reviews.text: The noise level rating is three because of the type of machine it is, not because of any quality issue. I do wear noise cancelling headphones when using. It does an excellent job of planing cherry, oak, maple hardwoods in the high speed mode. I have not used the fine finish mode yet, haven't needed to. I really like the preset thickness stops; you can plane down to standard thicknesses easily. It is pretty heavy so I do recommend a sturdy stand; locking casters on the stand could be essential if space is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: MHome

customer_reviews.title: Great planer, but the dust collection is problematic
customer_reviews.text: The planing was smooth and easily adustable. With fresh blades, the finish is nice and smooth. The extension tables help with reducing snipe, and this saves material. But the accelerated chip throwing is too much without a full dust collection setup. There are even videos to attempt to address this, so it is obviously well known. Planing performance is exemplary, but dust ejection is not usable for all users
customer_reviews.author: SaneMan

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality machine. Usually don’t buy Dewalt, but was surprised at the quality and operation of this machine. Have run quite a bit of pine that was a little sticky but totally dry. Changed out the knives already because it started to drag. Not dull just gummed up. Up and running again, no problem. Will clean and sharpen knives and ordered another set oem. Changing knives is easy, but a little time consuming. Great planer for the price. See how it holds up in the long run. Update: this machine is still working great. Have put a lot of material through it with no issues. Knives are not difficult to change out. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Little Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE** Husband has used this and said it works really well, he has enjoyed it. I bought this as a gift for my husband, however, he has not had the chance to use it yet. I purchased it because of the great reviews on this product and the value of it. It also is supposed to be easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: tnfarmgal

customer_reviews.title: Really good plainer. Would recommend it .
customer_reviews.text: I have done several projects now that I’ve had this plainer for a while . It works great. Has lots of extra features that others don’t. Not as loud as I expected it to be. You still have to wear hearing protection all planners are loud. Work comes out so sooth only needs fine sanding to finish. Trust the instructions you need a dust recovery system, a shop vacuum just won’t handle it. Definitely buy the up graded model with the in and out feed tables, that will almost eliminate skyping
customer_reviews.author: Otis W.

customer_reviews.title: Planer is extremely easy and intuitive to use
customer_reviews.text: Planer is extremely easy and intuitive to use. Settings are clear and accurate and finish is extremely smooth. It functions perfectly on boards. When trying to plane products that have been assembled, such as drawer faces or small cabinet doors, there is a very slight ridge that is left at each joint. This is easily remedied with a belt sander; however, other planers I have used have not done this. Product has the typical DeWalt durability.
customer_reviews.author: Oydoy79

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Before getting to my cabinets I had to plane down 120 "true" ruff cut 1x4's for fencing. The unit handled it without any issues or hick-ups. I mounted the unit onto a box with rollers, modified the chip port to fit my shop vacuum system, and added in/out feed tables for longer boards. I have an entire kitchen to remodel, so this DW735X will get a real workout. So far the unit has upheld the Dewalt name as I would expect. If you can't afford a higher end rig, this one might just be what you're looking for. Keep it clean and take care of it, it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ski

customer_reviews.title: Great planner, get one!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before buying this planner, after using it for a few hours I could tell you what the people complained about are probably cause by the fact they don’t know how to use it, I have been using equipment like this for over 60 years, great planner just have to use it within its capabilities, just found out that my hose and garbage can lid that I have from my Works blower/ vacuum works great makes almost no mess and fills up the garbage can with liner.
customer_reviews.author: Zim-Bob

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and does exactly what it should
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking at this planer then you have likely already done a lot of research. Everything will point to this model and in my opinion its totally worth it. Very easy to use and does exactly what it should. Maintenance is a sinch and the built in blower is awesome. The Dewalt blades dont last to long and i would not purchase them for replacement blades.
customer_reviews.author: craig

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Exhaust Fan
customer_reviews.text: The thickness planer does a great job; the two speeds allow for aggressive removal and for a finishing pass; there is little snipe if you lift the end as it leaves the planer. It is easy to set up and to adjust the amount of thickness to be removed. The planer comes with a powerful fan that ejects the chips with great force. I am using a shop vac to capture the chips which isn't working all that well. The force of the fan actually blows the chips out of the top of the shop vac. In fairness, the specs indicate that an ordinary shop vac may be overwhelmed by the fan. That's true.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Sladowski

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in my shop.
customer_reviews.text: This tool does almost all my work for me. Hardly any snipe. Easy to use and gauge board thickness. I want to eventually invest in the helix head cutters because of the longevity but I’m extremely happy with the stock blades. What made this purchase even better was 5he extra set of blades and the indeed/outfeed shelves/tables that were included in the price. I couldn’t have gotten the same deal at the big box stores for the same price. I just feel bad for the UPS guy who carried it up to my house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home hobbyists!
customer_reviews.text: I love this planer. Simple to use, dual setting makes a fine finish. Easily upgradable to the helical cutters. If the finish isn't fine enough, a couple passes with some 220 grit finishes it off. Self setting blades that are accessible through six screws. One thing to note, you require at least a 1.5 hp dust collector if you have an aluminum trash can cyclone setup. Otherwise the blower on this will blow the chips faster than e collector sucks, causing dust to fly out the edge of the lid. Funny to watch.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit but check the motor brushes!
customer_reviews.text: Out of nowhere after lots of use the motor seemed to bog down during a cut and seized. It turned out one of the motor brushes got stuck in it's sleeve and was arcing, reducing power until the armature melted. Dewalt replaced the motor under warranty. Other than that it saw lots of use and ran like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: This one bit the dust right off the start!
customer_reviews.text: The item worked for 2 thin passes and the motor started pulsating and then smelled like something shorted out after which it stopped working. For being made out of a lot of plastic it’s still pretty heavy duty. I just got a bad apple, which is a pain when you needed it for a project. Some things are better purchased locally in this regard.
customer_reviews.author: Dance Mom & Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Machine
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down and bought one of these tools. I had always heard that this was the model to get and the rumors are true. It's a well thought-out machine that functions great. You will need to have some sort of dust collection set-up to operate unless you don't care about wood chips flying everywhere. I ran a 4 inch flexible dryer vent hose to a trash can and covered the top with a thin towel and it really did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Stoutsenberger

customer_reviews.title: Bought this on a special deal and couldn't be happier. While I'd love to have a bigger floor ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a special deal and couldn't be happier. While I'd love to have a bigger floor model, I simply don't have the space. Blades are easy enough to change and the ability to swap for a Shelix head down the line is a great bonus. My one gripe is that the outfeed table cannot flip up for storage like the indeed can. It's easy enough to take off and put on, but it's an issue for me nonetheless. It's still by far a 5 star machine to me though.
customer_reviews.author: J Freund

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: This planer is great! Very easy to use. Very forgiving. I am a beginner in woodwork, and I can go to the lumber yard, pick a greyish piece of wood, and, through the magic of that planer, transform said piece of wood into a beautiful hot plate or a clock face. Just be aware that a planer creates a lot of dust! Also, every wood is different, some of them produce very sticky dust, some of them don't, so, always watch that gauge and how much you're going to shave off the plank.
customer_reviews.author: Olivier Garnier

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The planer was defective upon arrival. Dewalt is giving me a difficult time replacing the unit which I returned. It’s approaching 2 months since my initial purchase. They have my money & the original unit. I couldn’t be more disappointed & displeased.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent job of planning rough lumber boards.
customer_reviews.text: Had bought some rough sawed lumber boards of oak, pine, and walnut, and needed a good planner to smooth them down to lumber that I can use to make furniture from. The rough lumber came in 8-9 ft lengths and 8 1/2 to 9 1/2 in.width, so I had to build a workbench to set it on and long enough to handle 9 ft boards. Have run some of the rough boards through the DeWalt planner, and they came out perfect for my use.
customer_reviews.author: sandra  y. meyer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Very good package, done a couple hundred board feet with it.. everything from dimensioning rough (chain saw cut) home-made lumber, to just taking the paint off of boards being repurposed. Adjustments are easy and smooth.. Damn noisy, but all of them are. had to make a directional exhaust to deflect the chips. The infeed and outfeed trays are well worth it.. you can NOT make home-made tables to do the same thing that have the functionality of these. Particularly like the quick release on the tables....
customer_reviews.author: L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Planner
customer_reviews.text: Best planner I have owned. My Delta stripped the main gear and it was going to cost over $100 to fix. Purchased this planner and from the first cut I loved it. I received NO snipe at the ends of the boards and it provided a silk like finish. As all planners, it is noisy and should be worn with ear protection. The vertical adjustment is with a large wheel which makes fine adjustments very easy. The exhaust is great because of a build in fan. I have not hooked it up to my vacuum system but I'm sure it will work great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Tymer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Planer - 2nd time was a charm
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Hands-down, this planer is the best in it's class. Cons: The first one arrived broken... not a shipping problem, it was crushed inside the Styrofoam packing. Thankfully Amazon's amazing customer service resolved it for me ASAP and I had a new one two days later. Dewalt replied to me about the issue 2 weeks after the fact. The knives factory-installed in the planer have a nick in them that leaves a small line down the wood. Otherwise the finish is outstanding. Snipe is considerable, but that's unavoidable. Overall, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Vora

customer_reviews.title: New now working motor sounds funny
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a day then motor started sounding funny and tripped onboard circuit breaker. Cleaned out everything cant find any issues. Have not checked brushes but shouldnt need to on a new machine with a couple hours of time on it. Hopefully someone with dewalt can reach out to me to let me know if I'm missing something or just got a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Darby Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an intermediate wood worker, but haven't used a planer for 25 years since high school wood shop. This product was simple to setup and use and the infeed and outfeed tables are absolutely worth the price for this model. Makes it much easier to use and the finished product is super smooth and accurate. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: First shipment was defective
customer_reviews.text: After initial inspection, the bed was defective with a high spot. Wood get scratched when I rub the wood lightly on it. This will cause a long scratch on a work piece under normal usage. Will update review after a I receive a replacement unit.
customer_reviews.author: Judson Chung

customer_reviews.title: Great planer
customer_reviews.text: Very nice planer, great capacity and adjustability. Blade life is not as great as I’d like, but are reversible. Took about 45 minutes to change all three blades the first time through, but expect it will be faster next time. The two speed options are nice; faster speed for first passes and slower for finish pass. Loud, so use hearing protection.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ross

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well designed, and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Solid mechanism, well-designed blade change, a very accurate four-corner crank lift, and a chip blower which will overwhelm any shop vacuum and happily spread sawdust through your entire neighbourhood. The two speed operation will both thickness, and finish most woods perfectly with minimum (if any) snipe - just be SURE to remove all staples and screws first!
customer_reviews.author: Simon Hunt

customer_reviews.title: This planner is worth its weight in gold!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father as a surprise for Christmas last year. I gave it a whole year to review this planner. It's the best gift I ever gave him all the 50+ years !!! He has used it at least once a week and as much as 5 times a week. What a great product! Desalt has great,durable products.
customer_reviews.author: Lawdawgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great plainer
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy to use. Potable as long as you can mave it(90lbs). There will be a little snipe as the last of the board comes out, but if you help it out by hand by keeping pressure downward close to the outfeed it takes most of it away. Or get/make a larger outfeed table. The snipe is never bad though, easy to sand out or use a card scraper on.
customer_reviews.author: Dan G

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. The extra tables on this model makes a huge difference in reducing snipe. The chip fan is great for controlling the chips. I have it blowing into a garbage can with no need to fill up a dust collection system. It is ready to go right out of the box. So happy with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: How did I ever live without this???
customer_reviews.text: The best and most used tool in my workshop. Takes rough lumber and produces beautiful clean wood perfectly dimensioned. Great quality tool and easy to setup and use. I recommend getting the stand too. It makes moving the tool around the shop easy and the planer sit on it perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Roadking2001

customer_reviews.title: The Alaska Home DeWalt Built.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this almost non stop since I purchased it. I build a home on an Island in Alaska. All the interior and the decks have been planed from rough sawn Red Cedar off my property. The floors are done in Western Hemlock all planed by this great little tool. This is a serious machine. Over the last 3 years I have been slowly replacing all my worn out Craftsman and Makita tools with DeWalt. I wish I would have chosen the yellow and black earlier!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Happy I spent the money.
customer_reviews.text: This planer is ready to go right out of the box. Planes oak and cherry to glass smooth surface. Replaced 12 - 15 year older planer from another manufacturer. Other reviewers have mentioned the power of the chip blower. All true, it is powerful. If you don't have a dust collector buy a Rockler dustright 5 micron replacement bag for wall dust collector. Available through Amazon and Rockler. There are several YouTube videos on setting the bag up. I am impressed with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A Bouton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!  Very manageable snipe.  Lots and lots of saw dust/chips.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. I heard that it wouldn't snipe at all, which isn't true, but the snipe is very light and easily removed with finish sanding. Be prepared with a plan to handle the saw dust coming off this machine. It will overwhelm you and any shop vac you try to hook up to it. I have a 16 gallon shop vac and it can't begin to keep up. Plan for a collection can or box or something.
customer_reviews.author: BenR.

customer_reviews.title: Scrap to gold
customer_reviews.text: Love my purchase and can’t believe that it took me two months to decide what brand and model planer I should purchase. The planer is easy to setup and use. From box to running first board through the planer 5 minutes. In goes a unacceptable piece of wood and PUFF out comes a piece of gold. I have used the planer for five days and I cannot find a single negative thing. Purchase with full confidence in Dewalt .
customer_reviews.author: SAW

customer_reviews.title: Great planer for the money
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this one from an old Ridgid brand planer. Much better surface than the Ridgid even after giving it new blades. This is a great addition to a serious hobbyist work shop. I like the fact the Dewalt comes with an extra set of blades right out of the box. It would have been thoughtful if they had designed a storage location for them on or in the planer body.
customer_reviews.author: mredburn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what we need
customer_reviews.text: This planer works great! The only thing that may be helpful, is to know that you need to have this in a warm area. I’m the rollers won’t work if it’s been in a really cold area. We have cold winters, so we have to warm up the shop first. Just something we learned, but an awesome planer!
customer_reviews.author: dolge.

customer_reviews.title: Very well pleased !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had purchased this planer a long time ago. Don't have any issues with planer dip with the in and out feed tables attached. There is very little sanding needed on final product. Chip ejection fan is great, there's no plugging issues with it connected to the dust collection system. Really the only issue I have is with the raising and lowering. It seems to be rather tight but I believe that is due to the fact that it doesn't have any type of locking system on it. The 2 speed feed is also a really nice feature. If you're looking for a new planer I would say to seriously consider this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s a very good planer. I bought this one because a friend has the same one and I have used it very much. I had a better deal because I paid less for mine with a spare set of blades and the In feed and out feed tables than he pain just for his planer
customer_reviews.author: James R Chilson

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good planer, a lot of the poor reviews are about damage during shipment, but the must have figured this out. Mine arrived in perfect condition. There is almost no assembly needed, just attach the adjustment wheel with one bolt and snap on the tables, plug in. Gives an excellent finish to white oak 1x10’s
customer_reviews.author: Roscoe 62

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this months ago!
customer_reviews.text: I had been considering buying this planner for several months. Saw it on sale on Amazon and bit the bullet. No regrets at all. Very easy to set up, great instructions, and works like a champ. It is a little loud, but I expected it to be loud, not sure how you make one that wasn't. That is what ear protection is for. Would not hesitate to recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: djclardy

customer_reviews.title: This is a very over priced piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: Not only do the blades dull in an instant but the rollers fail to pull the material through. It cannot even plane a 1/16 off of a Doug Fir 1x6 without bogging down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding planer! The in feed and out feed trays that come with this kit are a must. The fold up easily for compact storage when not using. The whole thing weighs 110 lbs so it’s a beast to unpack and get situated in the shop, but it feels very sturdy and well made and it does its job very well. I work mostly with Walnut and Maple, and it has powered right through these hardwoods without any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: PilotJordan

customer_reviews.title: Good blades for wood without nuts
customer_reviews.text: Works well on wood without knots. I planed poplar and it did a wonderful job. It came out shiny and soft. But when I ran 1 piece soft pine with knots, the blades got dented immediately. Not I have nice striped on other woods, until I sharpen or replace the cutting blades again.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt DW735X 13" Two speed planer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for two years and it cuts through, red oak, red maple, pine, aspen. Even two inch thick, 12" wide and 8' long oak planks. Easy to access the cutting heads, replace and clean. Solid unit, bit noisy, use safety glasses and ear protection. Works great outdoors with just hose exhaust for shavings. Indoors, large, strong shop vac handles the shavings with ease, but will fill vac container fast. The entry and exit platforms make it much easier to load boards and receive them with reducing planing marks. It is a bit more expensive than a lot of other units, but the quality and handling seem well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Jung

customer_reviews.title: Amazing machine
customer_reviews.text: Received my 735X today, and of course immediately tested it out. After minor adjustments to co-plane the infeed and outfeed tables and attaching the crank handle, this machine was ready to go. The DeWalt planer effortlessly took any piece of wood I could throw at it and left a wonderful, nearly no-sand finish, including in mildly figured hardwood. One feature I was VERY impressed with was the built-in chip blower. The blower was strong enough to take the vast majority of the shavings and push them through 10 feet of hose into my dust collector, while the collector was off. VERY impressive. Definitely a must-have if you want a great planer at a decent price
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: You will not find a better planer in the price range
customer_reviews.text: Here is the short version on everything you need to know about this planer: You will not find a better planer in the price range, high quality product and produces high quality work. Easy to use and a pleasure to work with. I had the DW735x, sold it for a 3HP 15" planer, then sold that and bought a new Dewalt. I am very happy for a hobbyist wood worker it is just such a more pleasurable and usable tool with less upkeep. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Perry

customer_reviews.title: Solid machine
customer_reviews.text: Have only run a few boards through the planer so far, but it's working well. Heavy and noisy, but I'm okay with that. I had read the ratings (rantings) about damage on arrival and checked carefully: packing material was broken and box had a gaping hole but planer was undamaged. Agree with opinion that packing could be better, but mine survived shipment. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Retired in Spokane

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and get running right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The DEWALT DW735X 13" Two-Speed Planer Package is a very solid and well-built easy to assemble and get running right out of the box. If I had to improve it and I will in the future and some sort of longer table in the back to catch pieces that are exiting the machine. I recommend to anyone who is on the fence in purchasing a planer to consider the need for an accompanying jointer to do the cost analysis of how much finished wood cost at your local big box home improvement store verse rough cut from a lumber yard that you can mill down. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K.

customer_reviews.title: Comes Close to Spiral Head Models
customer_reviews.text: Best rated benchtop planer I've used. Easy to adjust thickness; handles all kinds of wood; fan-assisted chip ejection is good. Connection of dust collection is easy but dust still escapes through the entry point for the wood. Instructions are minimal so having videos from users can help in setting machine, adjusting for various cuts, and especially changing blades.
customer_reviews.author: llohans

customer_reviews.title: The best bench top planer!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this model in many academic and professional shops so I decided to purchase one for my home studio. It is very well made, rugged and sturdy without being too heavy to actually move around. The finish results are incredible. I prefer it over the larger planer I use at work.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Aiosa

customer_reviews.title: Not for shipping
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent planner but not through amazon. It is heavy and doesn’t lend itself to shipping. It isn’t delicate but should also not be handled rough. Mine came damaged and had to be returned. This is a box store item. Safe yourself the headache and skip it here.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Boldman

customer_reviews.title: Darn good thickness planer
customer_reviews.text: I graduated from an old worn out DW733 to this. It is night and day. The DW735 is quieter, not much, but not "oh no I forgot my hearing protection!!" loud. Still wear hearing protection. The two speed is great, I ran some cherry through it on both speeds and the finish setting is indeed finish quality. I do recommend that you have this hooked up to a dust collector, because it will spew wood chips every where out the exhaust port.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W

customer_reviews.title: Undamaged on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I've heard great reviews of this planer but I hesitated for a long time because there are a lot of stories of machines arriving with damage, beat up packaging, etc. Mine arrived with a few tears in the clear plastic wrapper but zero damage to the box. No sign of being dropped. The planer runs great so far. I'll probably spring for carbide knives after I get through the edges it came with.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Meets and exceeds my needs and expectations.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on this planner were all over the place. I have two very experienced and active woodworker friends who have this planner and swear by it for the price. It came via freight truck right it my door. Not all that heavy actually. Well packed. I could easily move it from workbench to stand. Assembly time is negligible. The next day I used it for two hours on poplar and maple. Works great. Wasn't all that loud, but I use it with the garage door open. Combined with the Dewalt stand, this is a sweet machine. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: idk yet
customer_reviews.text: seems nice pkg a bit damaged but price went down and waiting to see if seller will honor new price since only 2 das have passed in event the do I will revise to 5 star if not I think product will be but seller would not.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Rouge 1

customer_reviews.title: Powerful planer! Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great planer! Added the shelix head for added performance, it has worked flawless for thousands of board feet!
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It is noisy; be sure to wear ear protection. But the noise is well worth the accuracy. Wish the adjustment handle was tighter. I don’t see the need for the play in it. But overall, this planer works awesome!! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Zero problems. I use it daily. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I use this every single day in my shop and have had zero trouble with it ever. Creates a nearly glass smooth surface and almost never creates board snipe or tearout for me. And with a planer, those are the things that matter to me. I’m not sure why amazon asks me to rate the noise level. It’s a planer, so its going to be very loud. It’s loud. It’s a planer. Of course it’s loud. The only way to get a quiet planer is to buy a helical head planer. And those are insanely expensive so the average person can’t afford them.
customer_reviews.author: George Koehl

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.  Severe Shipping Damage.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Planer. We have been waiting a long time to add this machine to the shop lineup. Unfortunately, the product arrived severely damaged and makes me question the quality of the material output, the accuracy and longevity of the machine. Upon opening the box, we noticed the bottom styrofoam packaging had been beat up and punctures from what seemed to be the weight of the planet. After mounting to a table I noticed the base corner was cracked. See photo for detail. Not sure how to handle this...
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J Doran

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great machine for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: This planer has added a whole new dimension to my small musical instrument building shop. I can now cut up my own wood and plane it to whatever thickness I desire and the surfaces come out as smooth and level as a sheet of glass. Good quality and the blades seem to be holding their edge quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Maysey

customer_reviews.title: really impressed
customer_reviews.text: very high quality, basically no set up, I was really surprised at the quality of finish this leaves, very nice, I bought this for making laminated cutting boards, the high quality finish saves me a lot of time, just pay attention, it has to be running when you change the cutter speed. I didn't see that at first and got caught in between settings so I unplugged it and gently fed in a board from the back to touch the blade while applying a little tension to the speed selector, it popped right in. I got lucky, make sure you read the direction right above the switch.
customer_reviews.author: moosel

customer_reviews.title: Great planer for the money, the 2 supports is a must!
customer_reviews.text: Had the planer for 2 weeks. So far so good. You definitely want the 2 support pieces. Couldn't imagine not having them as they support longer pieces of wood well. I know there are mods for the blades, in the future I may purchase those. So far I haven't experienced any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I've had was the chip shoot gets plugged know and then and you have to do some disassembly to get it cleared. It does have a very strong blower on it so I may be just trying o take off too much material per pass when dressing rough cut lumber.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Racer

customer_reviews.title: Nice planer for a small shop
customer_reviews.text: Kinda "pricey" but a very nice, sturdy, and accurate planer ideal for a small shop. I would have given it 5 starts except for one major design flaw... Why on earth would they design the chip collection centered over the exit point?
customer_reviews.author: dfoxer

customer_reviews.title: love the tool i used it for the 1st time ...
customer_reviews.text: love the tool i used it for the 1st time in my wood shop im a beginner but im super happy with this Dewalt DW735X wood surface comes out smooth and like glass, i also made a mobile cart for it out of 3/4inch plywood
customer_reviews.author: Ken Ransom

customer_reviews.title: great unit and great deal
customer_reviews.text: this machine works really well but you must have a dust collector. without a dust collector it's very messy. it works really nice, plane really nice. the finish is gloss smooth
customer_reviews.author: ZaT

product_meta.title: DEWALT 13-Inch Thickness Planer - Three Knife, Two speed, DW735X model
product_meta.description:
Style:Planer13IN PLANER W/EXTRA KNIVES AND TABLES, Made in: Taiwan, Dimensions: 21.75 X 24.25 X 22. Weight: 102

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The DEWALT DW735X 13-Inch, Three Knife, Two Speed Thickness Planer has a powerful 15 AMP, 20,000 RPM motor (10,000 RPM cutterhead speed) that handles larger cuts in wider materials with ease. The three knife cutter-head delivers 30% longer knife life and makes knife change faster and easier. The two speed gear box allows users to change feed speed to optimizing cuts per inch at 96 or 179 CPI. It has a fan-assisted chip ejection that vacuums chips off of the cutter-head and exhausts them out of the machine. With a 19-3/4" cast aluminum base it is 2X more rigid than a standard 10" base and folding tables. The automatic carriage lock reduces the movement that causes snipe without the need for manual engagement by the user. It also has a material removal gauge and extra-large thickness scale that deliver accurate cuts with every pass. The extra-large turret depth stop allows users to return to most frequently used thicknesses with ease. Includes infeed and outfeed tables and an extra set of knives.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One Stationary 13" Planer, in/out feed tables, extra blades and dust hose adapter. Stand is not included.
Planer dimensions: 24” L x 22” W x 18” H. Depth capacity: 6-Inch. Max depth cut: 1/8-Inch. Width capacity: 13-Inch. Tool weight: 92 pound
Specifications: Made for 110V, not convertible to 220V. Includes automatic carriage lock that reduces the movements and snipes. Not compatible with Wi-Fi or Bluetooth
Two-speed gearbox allows users to change feed speed to optimizing cuts per inch at 96 or 179 CPI

specifications.Included Components: Dust hose adapter; Dust-ejection chute, extra knives
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,751 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
